title: Task 5: Replace time.sleep() in Batch Adapter Tests
description: Refactor tests/engine/test_batch_adapter.py to use threading.Event and threading.Barrier for deterministic synchronization instead of time.sleep(). Eliminates flakiness risk from timing-dependent thread coordination.

title: [plugins-sinks] DatabaseSink reports size_bytes=0 while hashing "[]" for empty writes
description: DatabaseSink computes content_hash from the JSON payload "[]" but returns size_bytes=0 for empty writes, so size_bytes does not match the hashed payload length.

title: P3: CallVerifier field-level order sensitivity config
description: CallVerifier only supports instance-level ignore_order configuration. Users cannot specify that some fields are order-sensitive (ranked results) while others are order-insensitive (tags). This forces a global trade-off between false negatives and false positives. Fix: Add field_order_config dict parameter, implement custom ignore_order_func callback. Phase 2 of two-phase approach. See docs/bugs/open/core-landscape/P3-2026-01-29-verifier-field-level-order-config.md

title: [core-security] General Azure Key Vault secret loading
description: Fingerprint module has Azure Key Vault integration for fingerprint key but capability is not exposed as general-purpose secret loader. LLM API keys and database credentials must use env vars only with no unified audit trail.

title: [EPIC] RC1 Phase 1: Critical Fixes
description: 4 critical fixes blocking production: CRIT-01 wire rate limiting, CRIT-02 replace defensive .get() with boundary validation, CRIT-03 call coalesce timeout in processor loop, CRIT-04 HTTP JSON parse error handling. See docs/plans/RC1-remediation.md Phase 1.

title: [engine-coalesce] Select merge strategy falls back to wrong branch when select_branch is missing
description: For merge: select, if the selected branch has not arrived, the executor silently falls back to the first arrived branch instead of failing or waiting for the selected branch. This violates the contract that select takes output from a specific branch only.

title: Task 3: Fingerprint Key Vault Failure Test
description: Create tests/core/security/test_fingerprint_keyvault.py to verify security boundaries. Tests: missing config raises ValueError, KV retrieval failure raises (no fallback), null secret raises, env var precedence, azure import error propagates.

title: [engine-pooling] ReorderBuffer ordering metadata is dropped before audit
description: ReorderBuffer captures submit/complete indices and timing metadata, but PooledExecutor discards those fields and returns only TransformResult. The ordering metadata never reaches the audit trail, violating the design requirement to record submit/complete indices.

title: [engine-orchestrator] output_mode uses Literal strings instead of StrEnum
description: AggregationSettings.output_mode is typed as Literal[single, passthrough, transform] rather than a StrEnum. Comparison sites in processor.py use raw string literals (if output_mode == single:) which are error-prone and inconsistent with other enums in the codebase.

title: [core-landscape] CallVerifier ignores list ordering by default
description: CallVerifier hard-codes ignore_order=True in DeepDiff comparisons. For order-sensitive responses like ranked results or tool calls, order changes are ignored and drift can be missed.

title: [engine-orchestrator] Trigger type misreported when multiple triggers are true
description: TriggerEvaluator.should_trigger() checks count, then timeout, then condition. When multiple triggers are true at evaluation time, it always reports the first in that fixed order, even if another trigger would have fired earlier. This violates the first one to fire wins contract and mislabels trigger_type in the audit trail.

title: [core-config] contracts/config.py imports core.config breaking leaf boundary
description: Contracts subsystem imports elspeth.core.config and re-exports Pydantic settings models, violating the leaf module principle. Importing elspeth.contracts loads 1,217 modules including pandas, numpy, sqlalchemy, and networkx.

title: [engine-coalesce] Coalesce timeout/incomplete failures are never recorded in audit
description: flush_pending() returns failure outcomes for require_all and quorum but does not record any audit state or token outcomes. check_timeouts() only merges when quorum is met; if quorum is not met at timeout, no failure is recorded and the pending entry persists.

title: Task 1: Double Token Outcome Recording Test
description: Create tests/core/landscape/test_token_outcome_constraints.py to verify the partial UNIQUE index on token_outcomes_table prevents recording multiple terminal outcomes for the same token. Tests: double terminal raises IntegrityError, non-terminal then terminal allowed, multiple non-terminal allowed.

title: [core-landscape] LandscapeExporter uses N+1 query pattern
description: Exporter performs nested per-entity queries: for each row query tokens, for each token query states, for each state query events. A 1000 row run with 5 states/token generates ~25,000 queries making export unusable at scale.

title: [plugins-sources] JSONSource crashes when data_key is missing or root is not an object
description: _load_json_array directly indexes data[self._data_key] without checking that the root is a dict or that the key exists. If the JSON root is a list or the key is missing, a TypeError/KeyError crashes the run instead of recording a validation error.

title: [EPIC] RC1 Phase 2: Core Feature Completion
description: 6 core features: FEAT-01 implement explain command, FEAT-02 wire TUI widgets, FEAT-03 implement checkpoints, FEAT-04 add missing CLI commands, FEAT-05 graceful shutdown, FEAT-06 circuit breaker. See docs/plans/RC1-remediation.md Phase 2.

title: [engine-pooling] Pool stats missing required concurrency and delay fields
description: PooledExecutor.get_stats() omits max_concurrent_reached and dispatch_delay_at_completion_ms, which are specified for node state context in the pooled LLM design. The audit context cannot report peak concurrency or the delay in effect at completion.

title: [core-config] PluginSpec schema hash missing for config-driven schemas
description: PluginSpec.from_plugin() reads schemas from plugin class via getattr but built-in plugins set schemas on instances during __init__. Schema hashes are None for config-driven plugins, defeating compatibility/change detection.

title: [engine-orchestrator] Enhancement: Enforce canonical-safe contract at transform output boundaries
description: Transform outputs should be validated to ensure they are canonical-safe (JSON-serializable per ELSPETH canonical JSON contract). Currently, the system relies on defensive deepcopy() in TokenManager to handle potential issues, but this masks plugin bugs rather than surfacing them. By validating at the transform executor boundary, we catch plugin bugs earlier with clear error messages.

title: [core-landscape] LandscapeExporter export is not self-contained
description: Exporter includes config_hash but omits settings_json and config_json from exports. Exported audit trails cannot be reviewed without access to the original database, defeating the 'suitable for compliance review' purpose.

title: [engine-retry] RetryConfig.from_policy crashes on malformed types despite graceful contract
description: RetryConfig.from_policy() claims to handle malformed policy values gracefully, but non-numeric values (e.g., strings or None) raise TypeError when passed through max().

title: [engine-spans] Aggregation flushes emit transform spans only, losing batch_id and aggregation context
description: SpanFactory provides aggregation_span with batch_id support, but AggregationExecutor uses transform_span for flushes. As a result, aggregation flush spans are not distinguished from normal transform spans and do not carry batch_id attributes.

title: Telemetry Phase 1: Core Infrastructure
description: Tasks: 1.1 Create telemetry package structure (events.py, protocols.py, hookspecs.py); 1.2 Add configuration contracts (enums, RuntimeTelemetryConfig, TelemetrySettings); 1.3 Implement BoundedBuffer with property tests; 1.4 Implement TelemetryManager with EventBus subscription; 1.5 Implement ConsoleExporter.

title: [engine-retry] RetryManager calls on_retry even when no retry will occur
description: RetryManager.execute_with_retry() invokes on_retry for any retryable exception, even on the final attempt when retries are exhausted, which can record phantom retry scheduled events.

title: [plugins-sinks] CSVSink rejects extra fields in free/dynamic schemas
description: For schema.mode=free or dynamic schemas, extra fields are allowed by the schema contract, but CSVSink uses a fixed header and csv.DictWriter defaults to extrasaction="raise", causing valid rows to crash when they include extra fields.

title: Telemetry Phase 0: Performance Baseline
description: Task 0.1: Benchmark EventBus dispatch overhead - measure time for event_bus.emit() with 0, 1, 3 exporters, measure pipeline throughput impact (rows/sec). Acceptance: <5% overhead at granularity=rows, <10% at granularity=full.

title: Telemetry Phase 2: Event Emission
description: Tasks: 2.1 Add telemetry events to Orchestrator (RunStarted/Completed, RowCreated after Landscape); 2.2 Add events to RowProcessor (TransformCompleted, GateEvaluated, TokenCompleted); 2.3 Add events to AuditedLLMClient (ExternalCallCompleted).

title: [EPIC] Critical Test Fixes
description: 6 test coverage gaps identified in docs/plans/2026-01-30-critical-test-fixes.md. Includes audit integrity tests, security boundary tests, and flakiness elimination.

title: [engine-retry] RetryManager on_retry attempt numbers are 1-based, while audit uses 0-based
description: RetryManager.execute_with_retry() passes Tenacity 1-based attempt_number to on_retry, but engine audit attempt numbering is 0-based (first attempt = 0), so callback consumers will record misaligned attempt indices.

title: Task 2: Processor Work Queue Iteration Guard Test
description: Create tests/engine/test_processor_guards.py to verify MAX_WORK_QUEUE_ITERATIONS guard prevents infinite loops. Tests: verify constant value is 10,000, exceeding limit raises RuntimeError, normal processing completes under limit.

title: [plugins-sinks] DatabaseSink rejects extra fields in free/dynamic schemas
description: DatabaseSink creates table columns from explicit schema fields (or first row for dynamic), so rows with extra fields permitted by free/dynamic schemas cause SQLAlchemy insert errors (unconsumed column names).

title: [engine-spans] Span names embed run_id and row_id, creating extreme cardinality
description: run_span and row_span use IDs directly in span names (e.g., run:{run_id}, row:{row_id}). This creates unbounded span name cardinality, which can overwhelm tracing backends and span-derived metrics.

title: [engine-coalesce] Coalesce merge metadata is computed but never recorded
description: Coalesce builds a rich coalesce_metadata payload (policy, branches, timing) but never persists it to the audit trail. Node state output only records merged_into and does not capture the merged row data or merge details.

title: [engine-processor] Row span token.id attribute becomes incorrect after fork/deaggregation
description: RowProcessor wraps the entire work queue in a single row_span created with the initial token_id. When transforms fork or deaggregate, child tokens have new token_id values but continue under the same row_span, so the token.id attribute is wrong for child token work.

title: [engine-spans] Transform/gate/sink spans are ambiguous when multiple plugin instances share the same plugin type
description: SpanFactory names and attributes use only the plugin type (e.g., field_mapper, csv), so multiple instances of the same plugin in a pipeline produce indistinguishable spans. This breaks traceability and makes it impossible to map spans back to specific node_ids or pipeline steps.

title: [plugins-sources] JSONSource accepts NaN/Infinity constants, leading to canonicalization crashes
description: Python's json.load/json.loads accept non-standard constants (NaN, Infinity, -Infinity) by default. JSONSource uses the default parser, so non-finite floats can enter pipeline rows (especially with dynamic schemas or any fields). Canonical hashing explicitly rejects non-finite floats, so these rows can crash later during hashing or audit recording.

title: [EPIC] Telemetry Design Implementation
description: Two-tier telemetry for ELSPETH: Global Telemetry (Tier 1) - framework-level audit events to observability platforms via pluggable exporters; Plugin Telemetry (Tier 2) - plugin-internal tracing. 4 phases: Phase 0 (benchmark), Phase 1-2 (core infrastructure + emission), Phase 3 (production exporters), Phase 4 (testing + docs). Design approved by 4-perspective panel (v3). See docs/plans/in-progress/2026-01-30-telemetry-design.md

title: Task 4: Checkpoint Topology Hash Mismatch Test
description: Create tests/core/checkpoint/test_topology_validation.py to verify resume with modified pipeline is rejected. Tests: identical graph validates, added/removed transform fails, modified sink config fails, missing checkpoint node fails, changed node config fails.

title: Task 6: Create __init__.py for tests/core/security
description: Create tests/core/security/__init__.py if missing to ensure proper Python package structure for security tests.

title: [EPIC] RC1 Phase 0: Quick Wins
description: 12 quick wins from RC1 remediation plan. High impact, low effort items including: QW-01 memory leak in _completed_keys, QW-02 silent JSON parse fallback, QW-03 duplicate PayloadStore protocols, etc. See docs/plans/RC1-remediation.md Phase 0.

title: [engine-processor] Enhancement: Benchmark deepcopy overhead in expand_token
description: The fix for P2-2026-01-21-expand-token-shared-row-data added copy.deepcopy() to expand_token to ensure sibling token isolation. This is correct for audit integrity but may have performance implications for pipelines with large row expansions. A performance benchmark should be added to measure the overhead of deepcopy for typical row sizes.

title: Telemetry Phase 4: Testing & Documentation
description: Tasks: 4.1 Property-based tests (circuit breaker, buffer, filtering); 4.2 Integration tests (high-volume, Landscape-first ordering); 4.3 Contract tests (ExporterProtocol compliance); 4.4 EventBus re-entrance test; 4.5 Update CLAUDE.md and create telemetry guide.

title: [plugins-sources] CSVSource and JSONSource report plugin_version as 0.0.0
description: CSVSource and JSONSource do not set plugin_version, so they inherit the base default "0.0.0". The orchestrator records plugin metadata from the instance; audit records show incorrect versions for these core sources.

title: Telemetry Phase 3: Production Exporters
description: Tasks: 3.1 Implement OTLP Exporter (opentelemetry-exporter-otlp); 3.2 Implement Azure Monitor Exporter (azure-monitor-opentelemetry-exporter); 3.3 Implement Datadog Exporter (ddtrace). All with unit tests and pluggy hook registration.

title: [engine-coalesce] Duplicate branch arrivals overwrite earlier tokens without error
description: When a second token arrives for the same (row_id, branch_name), the executor overwrites the first token in pending.arrived without error. This silently drops data and can merge the wrong token if duplicates occur due to retries or bugs.

title: [core-config] elspeth.engine.artifacts is a legacy re-export shim
description: engine/artifacts.py exists only to re-export ArtifactDescriptor from elspeth.contracts. This is a backwards-compatibility shim violating the No Legacy Code Policy. 94 test files still use the legacy import path.

title: [core-config] Config gate nodes use hardcoded metadata
description: Orchestrator registers config gate nodes with hardcoded plugin_version='1.0.0' and determinism=DETERMINISTIC. Config gates are engine-internal expression evaluators without plugin instances but should use engine version for auditability.
